content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here's the implementation of the `q_and_a_extractor` function in Julia:

```julia
function q_ands_a_extractor(md)
    questions = []
    answers = []

    lines = split(md, "\n"))
    for (i, line) in enumerate(lines)
        # Remove leading spaces and newlines
        line = strip(line)

        if startswith("# Question", line)
            push!(questions, join([lines[j] for j in i+1:i+n]...), " "))
        elseif startswith("# Answer", line)
            answer_start_index = i + 1
            while lines[answer_start_index] == "" || lines[answer_start_index] == " "
                answer_start_index += 1
            end
            push!(answers, join([lines[j] for j in answer_start_index:answer_end_index]...), " "))
        end
    end

    tuples = zip(questions, answers)
    return tuples
end
```

You can call this function with a markdown-formatted text `md` as an argument. The function will return a tuple containing the question and answer pairs extracted from the input text.
